subject: Re: [junit] Parameterized Test with Rules (withou special Runner)
msgSnippet: Very clever.  I d love to make it easier to make a system like this do all the right things, including generating a new version of the test class per data
messageBody:
Very clever. I'd love to make it easier to make a system like this do all
the right things, including generating a new version of the test class per
data point. But this could likely get many people 50% of the way there.

David


On Sun, Dec 16, 2012 at 9:07 AM, jens_schauder <jens.schauder@...>wrote:

> **
>
>
> If anybody wants to use parameterized Test, but can't use the
> Parameterized Runner, she migh be interested in an approach based on Rules:
>
>
> http://blog.schauderhaft.de/2012/12/16/writing-parameterized-tests-with-junit-rules/
>
> The idea is to have the current parameter value available from the rule
> and make the rule iterate through the different values, passed in at
> construction time.
>
> The source code is available at github:
> https://github.com/schauder/parameterizedTestsWithRules
>
>
